webdriver_test_tools.config package¶

Default configurations for various items in the test framework.

Config Classes¶

class webdriver_test_tools.config.browser.BrowserConfig[source]

Configurations for which browsers to generate tests for

Variables:BrowserConfig.ENABLED_BROWSERS – Dictionary mapping browser names to a boolean. True enables the browser, False disables it. Defaults to Chrome and Firefox since they’re not platform specific
ENABLED_BROWSERS = {'chrome': True, 'chrome-mobile': False, 'edge': False, 'firefox': True, 'ie': False, 'safari': False}
classmethod get_browser_classes(browser_names=None)[source]

Get a list of enabled browser classes

Parameters:browser_names – (Optional) List of browser names to get classes for
Returns:List of enabled browser test case classes
classmethod get_browser_names()[source]

Returns a list of short names for enabled browser classes

Returns:List of short names for enabled browser test case classes
class webdriver_test_tools.config.browser.BrowserStackConfig[source]

Global configurations for BrowserStack testing

Variables:
  • BrowserStackConfig.ENABLE – Set to True to enable BrowserStack testing
  • BrowserStackConfig.USERNAME – Account username. Projects will need to override this
  • BrowserStackConfig.ACCESS_KEY – Access key. Projects will need to override this
  • BrowserStackConfig.BS_CAPABILITIES – BrowserStack test configurations. Capabilities reference
  • BrowserStackConfig.ENABLED_BROWSERS – Dictionary mapping browser names to a boolean. True enables the browser, False disables it. Defaults to Chrome and Firefox since they’re not platform specific
ENABLE = False
USERNAME = None
ACCESS_KEY = None
BS_CAPABILITIES = {'browserstack.video': False, 'project': None}
classmethod get_command_executor()[source]

Returns the command executor URL

Returns:Command executor URL formatted with USERNAME and ACCESS_KEY
classmethod add_browserstack_capabilities(desired_capabilities)[source]

Update a desired capabilities dictionary to include items from BS_CAPABILITIES

Parameters:desired_capabilities – Desired capabilities dictionary to update
class webdriver_test_tools.config.site.SiteConfig[source]

Basic class for SiteConfig. Since this is specific to a project, this particular class isn’t implemented, but exists to define an interface for the 2 variables that need to be declared in SiteConfig.

Variables:
  • SiteConfig.SITE_URL – URL of the home page
  • SiteConfig.BASE_URL – Base URL for site pages (followed by a ‘/’)
SITE_URL = ''
BASE_URL = ''
class webdriver_test_tools.config.test.TestSuiteConfig[source]

Configurations for test suite

Variables:
  • TestSuiteConfig.RUNNER_CLASS – unittest.TestRunner class to use when running tests
  • TestSuiteConfig.RUNNER_KWARGS – Dictionary mapping parameter names to desired values used to initialize the TestRunner configured in RUNNER_CLASS
RUNNER_CLASS

alias of colour_runner.runner.ColourTextTestRunner

RUNNER_KWARGS = {'verbosity': 2}
classmethod get_runner()[source]

Returns RUNNER_CLASS object using RUNNER_KWARGS to initialize

class webdriver_test_tools.config.webdriver.WebDriverConfig[source]

Configurations for webdriver

Variables:
  • WebDriverConfig.LOG_PATH – Path to the log directory. Defaults to the log subdirectory in the webdriver_test_tools package root directory
  • WebDriverConfig.SCREENSHOT_PATH – Path to the screenshot directory. Defaults to the screenshot subdirectory in the webdriver_test_tools package root directory
  • WebDriverConfig.IMPLICIT_WAIT –

    Implicit wait time for webdriver to poll DOM

    Note

    Documentation says not to mix this with explicit waits and some instability was noticed when it was set to 10. Projects can override this if necessary. Implicit wait documentation

Browser driver initialization arguments:

Variables:
  • WebDriverConfig.FIREFOX_KWARGS – Keyword args for webdriver.Firefox()
  • WebDriverConfig.CHROME_KWARGS – Keyword args for webdriver.Chrome()
  • WebDriverConfig.SAFARI_KWARGS – Keyword args for webdriver.Safari()
  • WebDriverConfig.IE_KWARGS – Keyword args for webdriver.Ie()
  • WebDriverConfig.EDGE_KWARGS – Keyword args for webdriver.Edge()

Note

Logging configurations are set when the corresponding get_<browser>_driver() method is called. This allows for projects to override the LOG_PATH variable without having to also override all <browser>_KWARGS variables as well.

Mobile configurations:

Variables:WebDriverConfig.CHROME_MOBILE_EMULATION – Dictionary with ‘mobileEmulation’ options for Chrome

Headless browser configurations:

Variables:
  • WebDriverConfig.CHROME_HEADLESS_ARGS – Command line arguments to use in addition to the --headless flag
  • WebDriverConfig.FIREFOX_HEADLESS_ARGS – Command line arguments to use in addition to the -headless flag
IMPLICIT_WAIT = 0
FIREFOX_KWARGS = {}
CHROME_KWARGS = {}
SAFARI_KWARGS = {}
IE_KWARGS = {}
EDGE_KWARGS = {}
CHROME_MOBILE_EMULATION = {'deviceName': 'Pixel 2'}
CHROME_HEADLESS_ARGS = ['--window-size=1920x1080']
FIREFOX_HEADLESS_ARGS = []
classmethod get_firefox_driver(headless=False)[source]

Returns webdriver.Firefox object using FIREFOX_KWARGS and LOG_PATH to initialize

Parameters:headless – (Default = False) If True, configure driver to run a headless browser
classmethod get_chrome_driver(headless=False)[source]

Returns webdriver.Chrome object using CHROME_KWARGS and LOG_PATH to initialize

Parameters:headless – (Default = False) If True, configure driver to run a headless browser
classmethod get_safari_driver()[source]

Returns webdriver.Safari object using SAFARI_KWARGS to initialize

classmethod get_ie_driver()[source]

Returns webdriver.Ie object using IE_KWARGS and LOG_PATH to initialize

classmethod get_edge_driver()[source]

Returns webdriver.Edge object using EDGE_KWARGS and LOG_PATH to initialize

classmethod get_chrome_mobile_driver(headless=False)[source]

Returns webdriver.Chrome object using CHROME_KWARGS, LOG_PATH, and CHROME_MOBILE_EMULATION to initialize

Parameters:headless – (Default = False) If True, configure driver to run a headless browser
classmethod set_driver_implicit_wait(driver)[source]

Returns driver with implicit wait time set

classmethod new_screenshot_file(browser_name, test_name)[source]

Return the full filepath and filename for the screenshot

Parameters:
  • browser_name – Name of the browser (for screenshot filename)
  • test_name – Name of the current test (for screenshot filename)
Returns:

Filename for the screenshot
